item.title: Report E-2024080662
item.description:
Report E-2024080662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-20ft area of concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) drum. HEPACO personnel overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum and neutralized the impacted area. The recovered material was placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080560
item.description:
Report E-2024080560

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 9, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete surface and worked them in with hand tools. FCE crews utilized a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All paint impacted material and damaged product was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024080533
item.description:
Report E-2024080533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 8, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of printer ink were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE placed all damaged product into 55-gallon waste drums. The pallet carrying the freight was cut up and placed into waste drums. Granular absorbents and hand tools were utilized to remediate the site. All spent absorbents, damaged product, and the impacted pallet were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums

item.title: Report E-2024080556
item.description:
Report E-2024080556

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from two (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs due to improper loading of the freight for transit. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel neutralized the impacted area and placed the clean up debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail along with the leaking jugs. The generated wase was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
